decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using Geist of Saint Traft as the commander and a variety of control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on efficient removal, countering spells, and bouncing threats back to the opponent's hand. Furthermore, the deck includes powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance Geist's abilities and provide additional value. The creatures in the deck offer additional control elements and can help close out the game quickly. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish control early in the game, disrupt the opponent's plans, and ultimately win through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering spells, bouncing threats, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of counterspells like Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Mana Leak, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Volcanic Fallout, the deck aims to keep the opponent's board clear while developing its own card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gifts Ungiven. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Dack Fayden to generate additional value. With a variety of card draw spells and versatile threats like True-Name Nemesis and Torrential Gearhulk, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent in the long game.

This deck is focused on controlling the game through card advantage, countering spells, and taking extra turns. The goal is to use Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to filter through cards, generate card advantage, and eventually transform into Jace, Telepath Unbound. The deck includes various spells to interact with the opponent's board and disrupt their plan, such as counterspells like Cryptic Command and Mystic Confluence, bounce spells like Into the Roil and Repeal, and extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Mastery. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End and Elder Deep-Fiend to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The deck focuses on a control strategy, utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Tarmogoyf to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. It also includes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile for removal, as well as equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance the combat abilities of its creatures. The deck aims to maintain board presence, control the game through counterspells, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and powerful equipment. By carefully managing resources and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast its opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruption while setting up for combo finishers with cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Splinter Twin. It aims to slow down opponents with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while drawing cards and filtering through the deck with cards like Brainstorm, Fact or Fiction, and Impulse. The commander, Nin, the Pain Artist, provides card draw and removal while also serving as a win condition with the ability to deal damage to opponents. Overall, the strategy involves disrupting opponents' plans, generating card advantage, and assembling powerful combos to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing Olivia, Mobilized for War as the commander to enable powerful plays with discard and madness effects. The main goal is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by casting aggressive creatures like Falkenrath Aristocrat, Vampire Nighthawk, and Hellrider. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish off opponents or deal with problematic creatures. Additionally, the deck includes a suite of disruptive cards like Rakdos Charm and Kolaghan's Command to keep the opponent off balance. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production.

The deck focuses on using Ruhan of the Fomori as the commander in a control archetype. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and True-Name Nemesis to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through efficient removal and counterspells, while using powerful planeswalkers and creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells and bounce spells while establishing a strong board presence with efficient creatures that synergize well with the commander, Thassa, God of the Sea. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up a board of evasive threats that can quickly close out the game. It emphasizes tempo plays and card advantage to outmaneuver the opponent and maintain control of the game. Additionally, it includes a suite of versatile utility creatures and enchantments that can further support the deck's game plan and provide additional disruption options. The deck's strength lies in its ability to adapt to different situations and maintain a proactive game plan.
